description: Start at n, repeatedly apply pi(x) until reach 0; a(n) = number of steps to reach 0.
example: n=1000, the corresponding sequence of PrimePi-iteration is {1000,168,39,12,5,3,2,1,0}, whose the length is a(1000)=9. The numbers at which this sequence jumps from n to n+1 are A007097(n), terms of the primeth recurrence:1,2,3,5,11,31,127,709,5381,...
author: _Labos Elemer_, Mar 19 2001
